intro: Muscarella, commonly known as the rock rose, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Caryophyllaceae. It consists of several species, most of which are native to the Mediterranean region and parts of southern Europe. The plants typically have upright, branched stems and produce showy, clustered flowers in shades of pink, red, or white. They are often found growing in rocky or sandy soils and are adapted to dry, sunny environments. Muscarella species are valued for their ornamental appeal and are commonly cultivated in gardens.
